issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
Most of our tests are in the `test/integration` folder. Often they use a test world with specific models and plugins (such as the [pioneer2dx.cc test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/42215f2019f5ae64fc8a0610ef804a0fc53b0740/test/integration/pioneer2dx.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default)). One can also spawn models dynamically, like in the [joint_spawn.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/42215f2019f5ae64fc8a0610ef804a0fc53b0740/test/integration/joint_spawn.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) test. Recently I've been converting some of the tests using dynamic spawning to use a static world file instead, since it's easier to load in gazebo to reproduce the test behavior.

We should make a tutorial about this, but in the meantime, hopefully those are helpful examples.
content.html:
Most of our tests are in the test/integration folder. Often they use a test world with specific models and plugins (such as the pioneer2dx.cc test). One can also spawn models dynamically, like in the joint_spawn.cc test. Recently I've been converting some of the tests using dynamic spawning to use a static world file instead, since it's easier to load in gazebo to reproduce the test behavior.

We should make a tutorial about this, but in the meantime, hopefully those are helpful examples.

issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
It's very strange to me that the gazebo 7.0.0 debs don't have the test fixture, since that was merged in pull request #1621 in April 2015, and gazebo7 wasn't released until 2016. I'll cc @\_jrivero_ to help solve this mystery.

As a workaround, @cleyhee and @jordanlack is it possible for you to install gazebo from packages.osrfoundation.org? There are [instructions here](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install). I believe those packages have the `libgazebo_test_fixture.a` file.
content.html:
It's very strange to me that the gazebo 7.0.0 debs don't have the test fixture, since that was merged in pull request #1621 in April 2015, and gazebo7 wasn't released until 2016. I'll cc @_jrivero_ to help solve this mystery.

As a workaround, @cleyhee and @jordanlack is it possible for you to install gazebo from packages.osrfoundation.org? There are instructions here. I believe those packages have the libgazebo_test_fixture.a file.

issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw: Yeah we can do that. Since i'm working with a decent sized group of people and we have tight control over our configurations it's more a question of which version do we force all of the developers to use and make sure it's installed in an automated fashion for everybody, so updating to Gazebo8 isn't a problem logistically. We just generally try to stick with an LTS. I do see a new LTS comes out in January, so we could just update to Gazbeo8 for now and hop on the new LTS in January.
content.html: Yeah we can do that. Since i'm working with a decent sized group of people and we have tight control over our configurations it's more a question of which version do we force all of the developers to use and make sure it's installed in an automated fashion for everybody, so updating to Gazebo8 isn't a problem logistically. We just generally try to stick with an LTS. I do see a new LTS comes out in January, so we could just update to Gazbeo8 for now and hop on the new LTS in January.

issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
Thanks for tracking the problem. The explanation is easy, a good solution is difficult: the metadata for generating the debians in our building farm is totally isolated from the metadata used in debian for packaging (propagated to Ubuntu afterwards). Easy to see: this is the [file used to to declare files in -dev in our repository](#!/osrf/gazebo7-release/src/23684d0dd6738202c21e71fa5aa78100a5f93d2f/ubuntu/debian/libgazebo-dev.install?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [this is the file for the same goal in debian](https://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/debian-science/packages/gazebo.git/tree/debian/libgazebo7-dev.install). There is one line difference: yes, the `usr/lib/*/*.a`.

I think that we are good for trying to propose a Stable Release Update so we get the fix into Ubuntu Xenial. I need to check what is the proper for Debian Jessie, I will also do that.

Sorry for the inconvenience, the workaround is to install the `packages.osrfoundation.org` repository and get the most updated gazebo7 from there.
content.html:
Thanks for tracking the problem. The explanation is easy, a good solution is difficult: the metadata for generating the debians in our building farm is totally isolated from the metadata used in debian for packaging (propagated to Ubuntu afterwards). Easy to see: this is the file used to to declare files in -dev in our repository and this is the file for the same goal in debian. There is one line difference: yes, the usr/lib/*/*.a.

I think that we are good for trying to propose a Stable Release Update so we get the fix into Ubuntu Xenial. I need to check what is the proper for Debian Jessie, I will also do that.

Sorry for the inconvenience, the workaround is to install the packages.osrfoundation.org repository and get the most updated gazebo7 from there.

issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw: You don't need to upgrade to gazebo8. There are newer versions of gazebo7 (currently 7.8.1) on packages.osrfoundation.org that aren't available in the default ubuntu repositories.
content.html: You don't need to upgrade to gazebo8. There are newer versions of gazebo7 (currently 7.8.1) on packages.osrfoundation.org that aren't available in the default ubuntu repositories.

issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
I just checked it, we have the `libgazebo_test_fixture.a` present in the 7.8.1-1 version.

```
jrivero@nium $  dpkg -L libgazebo7-dev | grep fixture
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a
jrivero@nium $ dpkg -l | grep libgazebo7-dev | grep ^ii
ii  libgazebo7-dev:amd64                                  7.8.1-1~xenial                                        amd64        Open Source Robotics Simulator - Development Files
```
content.html:
I just checked it, we have the libgazebo_test_fixture.a present in the 7.8.1-1 version.

jrivero@nium $  dpkg -L libgazebo7-dev | grep fixture
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a
jrivero@nium $ dpkg -l | grep libgazebo7-dev | grep ^ii
ii  libgazebo7-dev:amd64                                  7.8.1-1~xenial                                        amd64        Open Source Robotics Simulator - Development Files
